Shore.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick question about the acknowledgements list
updates.update_content:
In case you're wondering, nobody hassled me about how long the rewards took. Apparently you folks really were in it for the game -- or to support me, which is even nicer.
However, I bet there are people out there who are working on Kickstarters. And they should be warned: it always takes longer than you think. To substantiate this, here's a timeline of Hadean Lands work that came after the game shipped.
Note that I did lot of reward design in December, but didn't order the stuff until early January. That's because I knew I would be out of town for the last week of December. I didn't want expensive parcels arriving when I was gone.

I just hauled the last batch of Hadean Lands CD packages to the post office. This means that the postcards, CDs, posters, and books are all out the door. US addresses should get their CD within a week, if it hasn't already arrived.
(If you are getting both a CD and a postcard, the postcard is packed in with the CD.)
That covers all the mass-produced rewards for this project. I still have the hand-made calligraphy and the cookies to arrange. The calligraphy will take a few more weeks; I need to buy supplies and remember how this "pen" device works. I will send private messages about that.

updates.update_userinfo: Why it takes longer than you think
updates.update_content:
I thought this was the boring part of the release process. Hadean Lands has been out for a couple of months, I've done a couple of iOS updates, time to settle down and work through the Kickstarter rewards. Plan for more distribution platforms, like Steam and the Humble Store. Boring stuff.
Wrong! It's crazy excitement time.
First thing this week, two fantastic reviews appeared:

The situation:
Postcards (roughly 600 backers): Printed, sitting in my living room.
CDs (roughly 550 backers): I have burned a master; will test this week and then send to replication. Should reach me by the end of the month.
Posters (roughly 200 backers): Being printed, should reach me this week.

I don't plan to do monthly updates any more, but it's the beginning of December and I happen to have some progress! (Not a coincidence -- I spent a bunch of the holiday weekend on rewards stuff.)
I've formatted the source-code book and pushed the data files to Lulu.com. I'm getting a proof copy back soon, and if that looks good, I can order the crate of books for those backers.

Since this Kickstarter is done -- not done done, I still have postcards and so on, but done enough for soup -- I should write the "support this other Kickstarter!" post.
I've already talked about Elegy for Dead World, which came to a triumphant conclusion a couple weeks back, and Extrasolar, which sadly did not. But there are lots of crowdfunders still open this season. Kickstarters, Patreons, Indiegogos... Indiegogoes? Indiegogols? Anyway, here are a bunch which at least brush up against the interactive fiction world.

campaign.story:
For the past three years I have been working on a photo-documentary project documenting the homeless condition here in Cincinnati. The purpose behind making these images was to illustrate the humanity of these individuals, as well as to provide an opportunity for the observer to gaze upon those who are often rendered invisible in plain sight.
Based on this portfolio I was awarded a solo show in the main gallery at The Carnegie Visualand Performing Arts Center in Covington, KY scheduled for January 2011.

My goal from the beginning was to amass a large collection of portraits of people experiencing homelessness with the purpose of producing an exhibit featuring said portraits.

The exhibit will be be an opportunity to create a setting that would foster an environment of education and awareness, as well as to provide a means of raising funds for local homeless outreach. I intend to donate profits from the sale of prints from this exhibit, in addition to encouraging those in attendance to bring non-perishable food items.
Having said that it will cost a lot of money to put this show on. I need to pay for frames, matte boards, prints, and other necessary presentation materials. I know that a project of this nature can be a tool used to make good things happen. If I can make this show a success in my community, I would like to do the same in other communities, to use what I have to help make a difference. The amount that I am seeking will barely cover the cost of just the framing, so the more cash I can raise the more I can do with this exhibit.
Please visit the link below to view some selections from this project.
http://matthewandrewsphoto.com/portfolio.cfm...

Hello everyone. My name is Justin Newberry, and I (along with artist Gilbert Cuevas) have been working on a graphic novel for the last several years between other projects and all the distractions life has to offer.
The book was originally planned as a six issue miniseries and would have come out around 2007/2008, but we suffered a number of setbacks and decided to just wait until we were in a position to publish the whole book. The interior art was finished earlier this year, so all that's left is to get the book colored and sent off to a printer...
And you can help! The way Kickstarter works is that you pledge money to the project instead of donating it and if we reach the funding goal before December 2nd, they collect all the pledges and then fund the project. Kickstarter doesn't take any money upfront and only charges your account if the goal is reached by the due date. That way, if a project doesn't reach its target, you're not short your pledge money. It's that simple!
With the help of Kickstarter and your pledges, we will pay a professional or a studio to finish the color work on the book. From there, we will have the book printed in the early part of 2011. After we have sent out copies to the kind people who pledge to the project on here, we will take the book to several comic book conventions and try to get the books carried in stores through various distributors. No matter the outcome though, we will be submitting more projects to Kickstarter in order to put out more products and give people a chance to interact with us while grabbing our stuff in advance and at a reasonable price.
The bulk of the money raised on here will go towards paying for the initial print run of the book (around $12000) with the rest going to the colorist to pay for their time. Anything generated above our funding goal will go towards printing more copies of the book and paying for booth space at conventions.

updates.update_content:
I just relaunched Super on a new page, with a fantabulously lower goal of $10,000! If you'd like to go re-pledge (and I hope you do), you can use the following link:
http://kck.st/jYUCIT
That'll take you to the new page straight away. If you notice that your old pledge level is no longer available but don't want to change your actual pledge, just let me know and I'll honor the old one if you add it this time out! And of course, please repost the link to anyone else you think may be interested.

Hey Folks!
It's been awhile since the last update, but now I think is the perfect time to let everyone know that I will be putting Super back on here in the next couple weeks! The color work on the book is moving along and I feel it's high-time to get the ball rolling again. Our new goal will be a mere $10,000 ($6,000 less!) to cover printing costs and shipping to to all those who pledge. Anything we make over the goal will go to either printing more copies (or switching to hardcover if we raise enough), registration fees for conventions, or paying for color work (so that I could use my money for other things to support the book, like travel expenses).

Hey there folks!
Sadly, as you can see, we did not hit our goal. We came close to the 50% mark, and I had some favors I could have called in to get it to 70-75%, but that still would have left us short.
So how do I feel? Alright, actually. Sure, I'm a little disappointed (who wouldn't be?), but I'm fine. Look, we had a pretty lofty goal there and to be able to say we did somewhere in the 10000-12000 range is saying a lot, especially in this economy. So instead of us looking at this as a defeat, I'm going to view it as a minor postponement in as far as our release date goes. It would be silly to have come this far, having a graphic novel that is complete save for colors, and stop now.

Hey everyone! Just a quick update to let you know that you can now read up to page twenty-five on aberrantpress.com! Feel free to go to the below link to jump back in where page 19 ;left off!
http://aberrantpress.com/blog/comics/super-graphic-novel/super-page-20/
Be sure to let people know about the project and encourage them to pledge!

Figured it was time to post the first of the sketches I'll be doing for people who pledge above the $60 level. I thought I'd mix in a few of these cover homages (which take longer since they usually involve more than just a simple character shot), but I had so much fun that they'll actually be the predominant kind of sketch I do! I'll be posting more of these as we go and I figure out which iconic covers to give the "super" treatment next.
Thanks again everyone!

After the first week and a half, we are 10% of the way to our goal! I'm pretty pleased with that result given how most of our promotional ideas haven't even gone full-blown yet.
In other news, I'm going to start posting some of the sketches we'll be sending out. I'm thinking of putting up a couple every week or two until the book actually comes out, with some posted for everyone and others strictly for backers.
As always, we're open to suggestions, so feel free to let us know if there's something you want to see and we'll try and make it happen!

We now have the video posted! Gilbert and I spent a few days working on it, and we think it turned out pretty nice (wish we could have gotten the music track working, but oh well). So be sure to give it a watch and of course, push it on everyone you know!

1% of the way there!!! Our thanks to you first few pledges, who have gotten us off to a nice start. Our first big push begins on Tuesday, so fingers crossed! In the meantime, I've decided to give the first 10 pledges a 3x3 sketchcard as a special "thank you" for your help. These usually only consist of a bust sketch of a character, but they'll hopefully make a fun little addition. Thanks again!
Justin
Video! We will have a video on the site give-or-take by Monday, depending on how long posting takes. In the meantime though, thanks for checking us out!
